context.p: Since most Linux distributions have "dnsmasq" or "bind" or another DNS server running on the same physical host as the CLC, DNS in Eucalyptus is disabled by default. You can enable DNS after disabling or re-configuring any other services that listen on port 53.

step.cmd: Open the /etc/eucalyptus/eucalyptus.conf file and the change value of DISABLE_DNS to N.

taskbody.result: Eucalyptus DNS server is now enabled. To verify that the DNS service is running, run netstat -al and look for 53. Port 53 should be bound by the process eucalyptus-cloud.
